ovdesc.p: Security Management System uses the EB.USER.PROFILEapplication to control the access to T24.
A User record must be created, for every person who is allowed to use T24, this contains:

p.p: identification details and specifies precisely what information and facilities are available,
dates and times at which the system can be accessed and other information required for Security Management.

ovdesc.p: Identifying details for each User includes:

p.p: Classification (External customer or Internal employee of the bank)

ovdesc.p: In addition, User preferences such as the Language in which messages are displayed, can be specified.
Details specifying when each User can access the system includes:

p.p: the maximum time, during which the User can be inactive without being Signed Off automatically.
the number of unsuccessful attempts to Sign On allowed before the Password is disabled.
the frequency with which the Password must be changed and dates between which the Password should be deactivated.

desc.p: Specifies the maximum time in minutes, the user can be inactive, without being Signed Off automatically.

If TIMEOUT.MODE in SPF is not defined as ACTIVE, and if the user has signed on to the system, and is being inactive for longer time specified in this field, the system will automatically SIGN.OFF. The user needs to SIGN.ON again before continuing.

The time count will be effective at all levels within T24. (In Classic - WAITING APPLICATION, AWAITING FUNCTION, AWAITING ID and AWAITING PAGE INSTRUCTIONS, and whenever the cursor is located in the ACTION line).
During an input session, when the cursor is within the Data Section of the screen, the time count will not be initiated.

If TIMEOUT.MODE is set to ACTIVE and when the transaction is not in the authorisation/validation phase, the system automatically signs off as an inactive user after this time. In the authorisation/validation phase the AUTOLOG.TIME.MINS period defined in SPF is used as the inactivity period.

PASSWORD.VALIDITY
Specifies how often or when, the user can change the password.
Next Change Date - If entered, must be greater than today's date.

p.p: It must be entered in the format DDMMYY or MMDDYY depending on the INPUT DAY MONTH (Field 29) format of the User record.
Spaces between days, months and years are optional.
Alternatively, the date may be entered in any of the standard formats permitted by the system.
If you do not enter the year and/or the month, the system takes today's date.
Every time the Password is changed, the system recalculates the date depending on the change frequency.

desc.p: Change Frequency- Can be daily, every 1-9 weeks, twice a month (on 15th and last day of each month) or every 1-6 Months.

p.p: Daily Enter D or DAILY. If you do not enter the Next Change Date, the system takes the Next Change Date as tomorrows date.
Every 1-9 weeks - enter Wn. where n is 1-9. If you do not enter the Next Change Date, the system takes the Next Change Date as n x 7 days from today.
Every 1-6 months - enter Mnndd, where nn is the number of months 01-06 and dd is the day in the month on which the password must be changed,

(01-31). If this date does not exist (e.g. 30th February) the next day will be assumed (1st March). If you do not enter the Next Change Date, the system assumes day dd in nn months from the current month.

desc.p: E.g.

p.p: If todays date is 26 FEB 1985 and you enter M0215 the system will assume the Next Change Date should be 15 APRIL 1985.
If you do not enter the Next Change Date, the system assumes the 15th of the current month if today is not after the 15th, otherwise the last day of the current month is assumed.

desc.p: Validation Rules:
This field is in two parts.

p.p: Next Change Date: 1-9 type D (date format in range 1950-2049) characters.
Default value is calculated by the system depending on the change frequency. (Optional input).
Change Frequency: 1-5 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character alpha) characters (Mandatory input)

LOCK.PREFERENCES - Prevents the user from accessing the 'User Preferences' option that includes various Desktop settings, file locations and system administrative functions, under the 'Tools' menu on the Desktop toolbar.

LOCK.DEACTIVATION - Allows the user to disable the "Deactivation profile" menu on the desktop.

Specifies the number of unsuccessful attempts, allowed to SIGN.ON, using the SIGN ON NAME (Field 2) of this record, before the password is disabled.
The system stores the number of unsuccessful attempts to SIGN.ON, since the last successful SIGN.ON.
When the number of unsuccessful attempts is greater than or equal to the number specified in this field, the Password will be DISABLED and all further attempts will result in SECURITY VIOLATION.
User records DISABLED are shown in the PASSWORD.EXCEPTION list.
The PASSWORD.RESET application allows the user (who has forgotten the Password) to reset the password.
Following are the reasons for the failure to SIGN.ON:

p.p: Today's date less than START DATE PROFILE (Field 8)
Today's date later than END DATE PROFILE (Field 9)
Time is earlier than START TIME (Field 10)
Time is later than END TIME (Field 11)
The Password has been deactivated (for further details see PASSWORD Application)
The Password has been disabled after too many unsuccessful attempts.
The User record is not in Live status i.e new input or change is not yet authorised.

desc.p: Specifies which Application can be used to access the company records. The company details are specified in the COMPANY RESTR (Field 17).
This field is used, together with the associated Fields 17 and 19-24 to specify precisely, which record and Application the user can access, using which Version and Function. It must be:

p.p: the name of an existing application,
the name of an existing USER.SMS.GROUP preceded by the @ sign (in which further input in fields 19.1 to 24.1 will not be allowed),
ALL.PG to allow access to all the Applications or
ALL.PG (program type) to allow access to all the Applications of a certain type (see below).

desc.p: The following program types may be used in conjunction with ALL.PG (e.g. ALL.PG.H) to give access to a particular type of program:

p.p: H Programs - the 3 standard files exist - Live, Unauthorised and History, e.g. CUSTOMER
U Programs - Live and Unauthorised files exist, but no History, e.g. VERSION.
L Programs - only a Live file exist (updated automatically by the system) e.g. STMT.ENTRY (only L, S and P functions can be used with this type of program).
M Programs - are designed to do other than processing the standard T24 functions, using a specific file e.g. PASSWORD.ENABLE, End Of Day Batch programs.
T Programs - handles automatically updated CONCAT files, e.g. CUSTOMER.ACCOUNT (only L, S and P functions can be used with this type of program).

desc.p: Note: The following 3 type M programs are available to all the users and cannot be restricted:- SIGN.ON SIGN.OFF PASSWORD
